snippet.textDisplay: Man, I was so excited cuz I made it to the western hemisphere, cruising the western desert listening to the cool melodic MS tune and suddenly...out of nowhere! this gigantic black aircraft carrier!! coming from nowhere (I was thinking how is that possible? this thing so huge how come I never saw it coming?) and this song played....tis' ended in complete demise and almost made me start all over again, loved this game so much.

you know what's most sad about this...i played metal max 1 when i was a little kid and it was my very first RPG game. years after, i no longer remember the title of the game, but i still faintly some sound track and some story arc. this sound track brings back SO MUCH memory...
im just pissing mad now that i totally missed out on metal saga(no promotion or whatsoever? even shadowheart got more screen time than this...)

snippet.textDisplay:
No.
As I said, when you win, you basically break Scarlet, whom is discovered to be a battle android similar to a special character unlockable after another Mark hunt. You take her to a female scientist in one of the cities that you can ferry too, and she get's converted into a CPU unit for your tanks.
snippet.textOriginal:
No.
As I said, when you win, you basically break Scarlet, whom is discovered to be a battle android similar to a special character unlockable after another Mark hunt. You take her to a female scientist in one of the cities that you can ferry too, and she get's converted into a CPU unit for your tanks.

snippet.textDisplay: She can cripple a tank (aka, break a section) with one shot of her Anti-tank rifle. So yes.
snippet.textOriginal: She can cripple a tank (aka, break a section) with one shot of her Anti-tank rifle. So yes.

snippet.textDisplay:
She's the final mark in the game. You absolutely have to be lv 200 to even barely survive fighting her. You need all the best gear, the highest level of shiny coat for your war dog and never ride in the tank. 

IF, and this is a very very big IF, you beat her, you find out she's actually an android. Taking her to the female scientist in one of the cities, I forget which, will turn her into the best CPU in the game.
snippet.textOriginal:
She's the final mark in the game. You absolutely have to be lv 200 to even barely survive fighting her. You need all the best gear, the highest level of shiny coat for your war dog and never ride in the tank. 

IF, and this is a very very big IF, you beat her, you find out she's actually an android. Taking her to the female scientist in one of the cities, I forget which, will turn her into the best CPU in the game.
